text: Is there any unicode arrow symbol that I can use in variable names? `a→b` get's parsed as a function call. Some arrows also give an "invalid character" error.

elements.text: Is there any unicode arrow symbol that I can use in variable names?
a→b
get's parsed as a function call. Some arrows also give an "invalid character" error.
a☞b=1
this works

text: A step in the right direction, thank you :smile:

elements.text: A step in the right direction, thank you

text: <https://unicode-table.com/en/sets/arrow-symbols/#right-arrows> you can probably test your way through this page

attachments.title: Arrow symbols ← ↑ → ↓ ▲ ▼ :arrow_backward: :arrow_forward: Arrow and direction symbols in Unicode
attachments.text: There are upward arrows ↑, downward arrows ▼, and also round ↺, curved ↝, double ⇅ and triple ⇶. There's even a 3D arrow ➫!
attachments.fallback: Arrow symbols ← ↑ → ↓ ▲ ▼ ◀ ▶ Arrow and direction symbols in Unicode

elements.text: you can probably test your way through this page

text: But I would probably opt for a classic `a2b`

elements.text: But I would probably opt for a classic
a2b

text: I'll try, yes. I went through the wikipedia list but none of those worked.

elements.text: I'll try, yes. I went through the wikipedia list but none of those worked.

text: Well, I'm trying to make an unreadable mess of code a little more understandable so I'm looking for the most graphic variable names possible :joy:

elements.text: Well, I'm trying to make an unreadable mess of code a little more understandable so I'm looking for the most graphic variable names possible
a➞b=1
seens to work

text: but most of these don't seem to render all that great at these low resolutions

elements.text: but most of these don't seem to render all that great at these low resolutions

text: `➛` works as well. Was literally the first of your list I tried.

elements.text: works as well. Was literally the first of your list I tried.
How is yours called?

text: I'd like to look for a latex shortcut so I don't have to copy/paste.

elements.text: I'd like to look for a latex shortcut so I don't have to copy/paste.

attachments.title: ➞ - Heavy Triangle-Headed Rightwards Arrow: U+279E
attachments.text: Symbol: ➞, Name of the character: heavy triangle-headed rightwards arrow, Unicode number for the sign: U+279E, the icon is included in the block: Dingbats.

text: it was this one, i copy pasted

elements.text: it was this one, i copy pasted
Alright, thanks again!
Mine seems to work with
\draftingarrow

text:
I could only find that one too:
```for s in REPL.REPLCompletions.latex_symbols
    if occursin("arrow", first(s)) && Base.isidentifier( REPL.REPLCompletions.latex_symbols[first(s)])
         println(s)
   end
end```

elements.text: I could only find that one too:

for s in REPL.REPLCompletions.latex_symbols
    if occursin("arrow", first(s)) && Base.isidentifier( REPL.REPLCompletions.latex_symbols[first(s)])
         println(s)
   end
end

text:
That one's nifty, thanks. I was also looking for a dot (like ⋅) but didn't want to go thought another long list after trying the first 20 or so.
`"\\bigodot" => "⨀"` looks good. :+1:

elements.text: That one's nifty, thanks. I was also looking for a dot (like ⋅) but didn't want to go thought another long list after trying the first 20 or so.
"\\bigodot" => "⨀"
looks good.
